meanings.definition: A person or animal that bleats.
meanings.sent1: The farm was filled with bleaters, including sheep and goats.
meanings.sent2: The bleaters in the pasture could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent3: The bleaters in the petting zoo always made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The bleaters in the choir harmonized beautifully during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The bleaters in the meadow added a peaceful soundtrack to the countryside.

meanings.definition: A group of people or animals that bleat.
meanings.sent1: The bleaters gathered near the fence waiting to be fed.
meanings.sent2: The noisy bleaters roamed the hillside, creating a cacophony.
meanings.sent3: The bleaters in the park attracted a crowd of curious onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The bleaters in the audience cheered loudly at the end of the show.
meanings.sent5: The bleaters in the field moved together like a synchronized dance troupe.
